data.title: Richard Brooke (bef.1571-1632)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Richard Brooke born bef. 1571 Norton Priory, Cheshire died 1632 Norton, Cheshire, England including ancestors + descendants + 1 photos + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 14 Dec 2023 | Created 29 Mar 2013

This page has been accessed 1,371 times.

Contents

1 Biography

2 Research Notes

3 Sources

4 Acknowledgements

Biography

Sir Richard Brooke was the son of Thomas Brooke and Anne Touchet and was baptised on 14 March 1571 according to the peerage.com.

He married, firstly, Jane Chaderton, daughter of Rt. Rev. William Chaderton. He had one child, Elizabeth Brooke, with his first wife Jane. Apparently, Jane returned to her father's house with Elizabeth to live. Elizabeth was educated by her grandfather.[1]

Elizabeth Brooke 1595-21 Oct 1622 Elizabeth Jocelyn

He then married Katherine Neville, daughter of Sir Henry Neville and Ann Killigrew. [2]

Sir Richard and Catherine had children.[3]Sir Richard Brooke 1632

Ann Brooke, who married Edward Hyde

Sir Henry Brooke, 1st bt. Married Mary Pussey.

Dorothie who married Lawrence Hyde, younger half-brother of Edward Hyde

Thomas who married Jane (daughter of Weston of Sutton, near Frodsham).

Richard was a professor of physics, died at Broughton 1667, no issue.

George died in West Indies, no issue.

John

Mary married Thomas Marbury, (Sir Richard's half-brother)

Catherine

Christian

Elizabeth

Martha

Sir Richard died on the 31 March 1632 in Norton, Cheshire, England. "Sir Richard Brooke, Knight, 1632. R RICHARD BROOKE of Norton, in the County of Chester, Kt, depted this mortall life at Norton vpon the last day of March, 1632, and lyeth buried in Runcorne Church in the county aforsayd."[3]Sir Richard Brooke 1632

"This Certificate was taken at Norton, vpon the 10 day of June, 1632, by Randle Holme of the Citty of Chester, Alder- man, and testyfied vnder the hand of the sayd Randle Holme to be a trew descent." [3]Sir Richard Brooke 1632

"Arms , Quarterly , I and 4 , Or , a cross engrailed per pale Gules and Sable . 2 and 3 , Argent , a chevron Sable between three bucks ' heads cabossed Gules . Over all a crescent for difference . Crest : A brock or badger proper."[3]Sir Richard Brooke 1632

With Sir Richard's marriage to Katherine Neville, all of their children were included in the lineage from King Edward I. [https://play.google.com/books/reader?id=jfAxAQAAMAAJ&pg=GBS.RA2-PR19

Research Notes

Link to FSP for Family History with a Pedigree: https://www.wikitree.com/index.php?title=Space:Brooke_Family_History&action=edit

4, Sir Richard Brook, of Norton, Knt. son and heir, was knighted in Ireland, and married first, Jane, daughter and heiress of William Chaderton, bishop of Chester, by whom he had a daughter, (Mary) Elizabeth, wife of Thorold Joseline, of Hoginton, in Cambridgeshire, Esq. who had all her mother's lands. Sir Richard married secondly, Catharine, daughter of Sir Henry Neville, of Billingbere, in Berkshire, a younger branch of the Lord Abergavenny's family, by whom he had five sons, 1, Henry; 2, Thomas, who married Jane, daughter of Weston, of Sutton, near Frodsham, and had issue; 3, Richard, professor of physic, died at Boughton, near Chester, without issue, 1667; 4, George; and 5, John; and three daughters; 1, Mary, wife of Thomas Merbury, half brother, and afterwards heir to William Merbury, of Merbury, Esq.; 2, Anne, of Edward Hyde, of Norbury, juxta Pointon; 3, Dorothy, wife of Laurence Hyde, younger brother of the said Edward. Sir Richard died 1632.

[(https://play.google.com/books/reader?id=hLRBAAAAcAAJ&pg=GBS.PA335&hl=en The Baronetage of England, Or the History of the English Baronets, and Such Baronets of Scotland, as are of English Families, With Genealogical Tables, and Engravings of Their Armorial Bearings, page 335)]
